column4: Can't seem to find my Wireless Connection under system Admin....any ideas to help me install this.
I need help with my Wireless Connection...
Alan...I'm looking for help with my Wireless Connection....which I can seem to find under my "System" and "admin" menus...
gives you a notification area applet that has a drop-down list of wlan's it can find, yo click on one and it prompts for any necessary security credentials
or you can 'connect to other network' and manually type in the SSID and encryption settings
i should have specified it helps you configure the usage of an already recognized wifi chipset
it doesn't help you get an unrecognized chipset working
i'ver never seen that, can you copy/paste just the available to root part/
ah, run 'sudo lspci -v' and enter your login password when prompted
have you searched ubuntuforums for your chipset?
sorry i couldn't get you up and running
